description:
equi- +‎ -valent.
From Latin aequivalentem, accusative singular of aequivalēns, present active participle of aequivaleō (“I am equivalent, have equal power”).

adjectives.description: equivalent (comparative more equivalent, superlative most equivalent)

entries.meaning: Similar or identical in value, meaning or effect; virtually equal.
examples: To burn calories, a thirty-minute jog is equivalent to a couple of hamburgers.

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Of two sets, having a one-to-one correspondence.
(mathematics) Relating to the corresponding elements of an equivalence relation.
(chemistry) Having the equal ability to combine.
(geometry) Equal in measure but not admitting of superposition; applied to magnitudes.
examples: A square may be equivalent to a triangle.

entries.meaning: Anything that is virtually equal to something else, or has the same value, force, etc.

verbs.description: equivalent (third-person singular simple present equivalents, present participle equivalenting, simple past and past participle equivalented)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make equivalent to; to equal.
